column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) He's a generous person, trying to promote a charity stream that has raised millions to help kids in need
(B) He's a terrible person, trying to promote a charity stream that has raised millions to help kids in need
column3: (B) He's a terrible person, trying to promote a charity stream that has raised millions to help kids in need is the sarcastic statement as it is saying the opposite of what is true.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Hey just be happy then you won't be depressed anymore
(B) Hey just be happy that you won't be depressed anymore
column3: Option A: "Hey just be happy then you won't be depressed anymore" is sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Just memeing about being racist, that's what keeps it okay
(B) Just memeing about being racist, that's what keeps it toxic
column3: Option A: "Just memeing about being racist, that's what keeps it okay" is sarcastic because it suggests that being racist is not okay and that using memes to justify it is not acceptable either.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) You are mistaken when you say that he should have just let them get away for assaulting him
(B) You are right when you say that he should have just let them get away for assaulting him
column3: The statement sarcastic is (B) "You are right when you say that he should have just let them get away for assaulting him".

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) He didn't threaten, he only urged; totally different
(B) He didn't threaten, he only pleaded; totally different
column3: The statement "(A) He didn't threaten, he only urged; totally different" is sarcastic because it implies that the difference between an urge and a threat is not significant.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Wow thats crazy, I've never had a takeout meal that used hardwood containers before!
(B) Wow thats crazy, I've never had a takeout meal that used plastic containers before!
column3: Option (B) "Wow that's crazy, I've never had a takeout meal that used plastic containers before!" could be sarcastic as plastic takeout containers are very common and not really surprising.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Have you tried not being poor? It is much easier
(B) Have you tried not being rude? It is much easier
column3: Option A: "Have you tried not being poor? It is much easier" is the sarcastic statement.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Yeah. Let's get rid of the trams and build carriages instead
(B) Yeah. Let's get rid of the trams and build lightrail instead
column3: It is difficult to determine without additional context or knowledge of the speaker's tone and intention. However, (A) could be interpreted as sarcastic because it suggests replacing a modern form of transportation with an outdated one.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Yeah, I've noticed he's been drinking every day recently, what a great transformation
(B) Yeah, I've noticed he's been exercising every day recently, what a great transformation
column3: The statement that is sarcastic is (A) "Yeah, I've noticed he's been drinking every day recently, what a great transformation."

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) He's over six feet, so he must be tall
(B) He's over six feet, so he must be wonderful
column3: Option B: "He's over six feet, so he must be wonderful."

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:

column3: The sarcastic statement is (B) "Working at a McDonald's has made me an amazing chef".

column1:

column1:

column3: Option A, "Yeah, anarchism is taught as a prime example of a governing system," is sarcastic.

column1:

Options:

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) The best way to defeat a stronger/larger and better regimented force is by fighting on their terms
(B) The best way to defeat a stronger/larger and better regimented force is by fighting on your terms
column3: The statement that is sarcastic is (A) The best way to defeat a stronger/larger and better regimented force is by fighting on their terms.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) He's such terrible relationship material when he's drunk
(B) He's such great relationship material when he's drunk
column3: (B) "He's such great relationship material when he's drunk" is sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Welp, my $1000 dollar phone has bad battery life, guess I'll just have to return it
(B) Welp, my $1000 dollar phone has bad battery life, guess I'll just have to dumpster it
column3: Option B is sarcastic because the phrase "guess I'll just have to dumpster it" implies that the person is willing to throw away a very expensive phone over a minor issue, which is an exaggeration meant to be humorous or mocking.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) This website is well known to post falsehoods and spread false rumors. Rock-solid source if you ask me
(B) This website is well known to post falsehoods and spread false rumors. Suspicious source if you ask me
column3: (B) This website is well known to post falsehoods and spread false rumors. Suspicious source if you ask me.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Violence is a perfect way to unleash your frustrations
(B) Exercise is a perfect way to unleash your frustrations
column3: (A) Violence is a perfect way to unleash your frustrations is a statement that is sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Working the printer is too complex for me
(B) Working the microprocessor is too complex for me
column3: Without the context, it is difficult to determine the tone of the statements. However, if both are made in response to a task given and the person saying it is known to be proficient in technology, then the more sarcastic statement would be (B) "Working the microprocessor is too complex for me."

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Because no world needs more kids with trust issues and psychological problems than we already have!
(B) Because this world needs more kids with trust issues and psychological problems than we already have!
column3: The sarcastic statement is (B) "Because this world needs more kids with trust issues and psychological problems than we already have!"

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) You mean Knuth up arrow notation isn't unfamiliar for you?
(B) You mean Knuth up arrow notation isn't normal for you?
column3: The statement "You mean Knuth up arrow notation isn't unfamiliar for you?" is sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) You're right, it's the first week of winter! It will definitely get warmer in a couple weeks for our first playoff game
(B) You're right, it's the last week of winter! It will definitely get warmer in a couple weeks for our first playoff game
column3: Option (B) is sarcastic because it contradicts the fact that the last week of winter is generally colder than the first week, and so it implies that it won't get warmer in just a couple of weeks for the playoff game.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Sneaking out of a government facility with dangerous contraband isn't going to be easy
(B) Sneaking out of a government facility with dangerous contraband isn't going to be illegal
column3: The sarcastic statement is (B) "Sneaking out of a government facility with dangerous contraband isn't going to be illegal".

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Good thing things aren't more expensive now than they were eight years ago
(B) Good thing things aren't more expensive now than they were eight days ago
column3: The statement (A) "Good thing things aren't more expensive now than they were eight years ago" could be sarcastic because it implies that things are actually more expensive now than they were eight years ago, but the speaker is saying the opposite to make a point.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) You're welcome my dear friend. Always glad to feed the elephants, that woefully endangered species
(B) You're welcome my dear friend. Always glad to feed the trolls, that woefully endangered species
column3: (B) You're welcome my dear friend. Always glad to feed the trolls, that woefully endangered species is the sarcastic statement.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Without the river there's no water and no electricity. Blocking it is such a smart move!
(B) Without the river there's no water and no electricity. Blocking it is such a terrible move!
column3: The statement that is sarcastic is (A) "Without the river there's no water and no electricity. Blocking it is such a smart move!" because the speaker is saying that blocking the river, which provides water and electricity, is a smart move, when in reality it is not.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?

(A) What a poor guy, years of work and he only got a $50,000 scholarship
(B) What a poor guy, years of work and he only got a $50 scholarship
column3: Option B: "What a poor guy, years of work and he only got a $50 scholarship" is sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?

(B) That's only about $10 per mile for a van, perfectly reasonable fuel costs
column3: The statement that is sarcastic is option (B) "That's only about $10 per mile for a van, perfectly reasonable fuel costs."

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?

column3: Option (B) is sarcastic as it uses the same words as option (A) but with the opposite meaning.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?

(B) I lose money for winning? Sign me up!

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?

column3: Option (A) "The two minute wait in line is too long for me, I think I'll just leave" is sarcastic because waiting for two minutes is not a long time and the speaker is exaggerating their impatience.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?

column3: The sarcastic statement is (B) "He's just demented. Okay, well nothing wrong with him running the country in that case!" as it suggests the opposite of what is actually true.

column1:

column1:

Which statement is sarcastic?

column3: It is difficult to determine if a statement is sarcastic with certainty, but based on the comparison of the low cost of breakfast gruel or burrito to the high cost of protein supplements, option (A) is likely to be sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?

(A) I personally don't believe the 7 time felon that just got done murdering a random woman wouldn't lie

column3: The statement that is sarcastic is option (B): "I personally don't believe the 7 time felon that just got done murdering a random woman would lie." The use of double negatives and the context of the situation suggest that the speaker is being sarcastic by implying that of course the felon would lie in this scenario.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) I mean their graphics guy did spend 15 minutes max on doing the day's work and the rest messing around. Their employees are always the laziest!
(B) I mean their graphics guy did spend 15 minutes max on doing the day's work and the rest messing around. Their employees are always the best!
column3: The sarcastic statement is (B) "I mean their graphics guy did spend 15 minutes max on doing the day's work and the rest messing around. Their employees are always the best!" because the first part of the statement implies the employee is lazy, but the second part contradicts it by saying they are the best.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Isn't it just the best? This has been me for the past several days as well. It's been less than enough sleep for the past week
(B) Isn't it just the best? This has been me for the past several days as well. It's been more than enough sleep for the past week
column3: The sarcastic statement is (B) "Isn't it just the best? This has been me for the past several days as well. It's been more than enough sleep for the past week." The tone is sarcastic because it uses the same phrasing as (A), which is a common expression used to convey frustration or irritation, but the content of the statement contradicts that sentiment.

Which statement is sarcastic?

column3: Option (B) - "Calling a whole electorate 'morons' because they don't share the same political beliefs as you is a great way to win them over" - is sarcastic.

column3: The statement (A) "Wow, you only applied to 200 internships this past week?" could be sarcastic, as it sounds like the speaker is surprised or impressed by the number, but the tone could imply that they think the number is too high.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) College is happening: forgetting assignments, stressing over grades, worrying about finals, etc. It's been a stressful semester

column3: The statement that is sarcastic is (B) "College is happening: forgetting assignments, stressing over grades, worrying about finals, etc. It's been a fun semester." The use of "fun" to describe a stressful semester is ironic and sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:

column3: The statement (B) "don't forget there are people in suffering" is potentially sarcastic, as it seems to suggest that the speaker is not actually concerned with those who are suffering and may be making a sarcastic remark to dismiss or undermine the topic at hand.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?

column3: Option B, "Wow. You're right. All those memes in the bitcoin sub and people posting about making money and what they're going to buy with it sure turned off people investing from in it" is the sarcastic statement because it uses a tone that suggests that the opposite is true, while also mocking the idea that memes and people's plans for purchases had any effect on people's investment decisions.

column3: Option (B) "Well, Alabama did beat the 17th ranked team. Surely that should be enough to get them in" could be considered sarcastic because it implies that beating a lower-ranked team should not be a sufficient enough reason to get into an important event (such as a playoff or tournament).

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) You're not allowed to walk in the park, you can only do it on your own property
(B) You're not allowed to smoke in the park, you can only do it on your own property
column3: Both statements are a warning and not sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Handouts are unfair when they go to businesses, not consumers
(B) Handouts are fine when they go to businesses, not consumers
column3: The sarcastic statement is (B) Handouts are fine when they go to businesses, not consumers.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Good thing you can boil impurities out of water
(B) Good thing you can boil Uranium out of water
column3: Option (B) "Good thing you can boil Uranium out of water" is sarcastic as it implies that boiling Uranium out of water is impossible.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) If I associate something bad witih it, then my depression will never let me forget it. Weirdest memorization plan ever
(B) If I associate something bad witih it, then my depression will never let me forget it. Best memorization plan ever
column3: Option (B) is sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Quit fat-shaming the cat! They're people, too, you know
(B) Quit fat-shaming the cat! They're sensitive, too, you know
column3: The statement (A) is sarcastic.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) With new designs coming ten times slower than their competitors, Honda will soon be at the top of the market
(B) With new designs coming ten times faster than their competitors, Honda will soon be at the top of the market
column3: The statement that is sarcastic is (A) - "With new designs coming ten times slower than their competitors, Honda will soon be at the top of the market".

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Generalizing half the population and acting like women can't think for themselves will totally win you points with the ladies
(B) Generalizing half the population and acting like women can't think for themselves will totally lose you points with the ladies
column3: Option (A) is sarcastic because it uses exaggerated language to express the opposite of what it actually means.

column1:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) We've not spoken since graduating high school 7 years ago, she's basically my bestie
(B) We've consistently spoken since graduating high school 7 years ago, she's basically my bestie
column3: The statement that is sarcastic is option (A) - "We've not spoken since graduating high school 7 years ago, she's basically my bestie."
